result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Bradley TEMPLE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or a combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Order for Modifying Defendant's Bail.   
It is hereby ordered, based on the stipulation of the parties placed on the record on May 27, 2015, and the request of the alleged victims, Baily Kreie and Adam Temple, the no contact order is amended to allow the defendant to have non-assaultive contact with both.  The $1,000.00 cash bail is amended to $400.00.

$400.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 06-26-15 at 3:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
BAIL MOTION
Court modifies bail to $400.00 cash with no assaultive contact with Adam Temple and Baily Kreie.   
Minutes.
Motion for Bail Modification.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 05-27-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.
Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.
RE:  Adam Temple, on 05-10-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of substantial battery, disorderly conduct, 1st degree recklessly endangering safety and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-18-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Baily Kreie and Adam Temple and the residence of Adam Temple or any residence Adam occupies and defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court office in writing within 24 hours of release.  Cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
